wikipedia_page.main: John Arthur Blaikie (1849–25 December 1917) was an English poet and journalist, born in Poplar, Middlesex, and died in Kensington.

response: Gosse started his career as assistant librarian at the British Museum from 1867 alongside the songwriter Theo Marzials, a post which Charles Kingsley helped his father obtain for him. An early book of poetry published with a friend John Arthur Blaikie gave him an introduction to the Pre-Raphaelite Brotherhood. Trips to Denmark and Norway in 1872–74, where he visited Hans Christian Andersen and Frederik Paludan-Müller, led to publishing success with reviews of Henrik Ibsen and Bjørnstjerne Bjørnson in the Cornhill Magazine.
*Madrigals, Songs, and Sonnets (1870), co-author John Arthur Blaikie
* John Arthur Blaikie (born 1849), English poet and journalist.
* Love's Victory, an 1890 poem by John Arthur Blaikie
